title: Worked Solution
text:
To determine whether the value $$y= rac{1}{3}$$ is a solution to the equation $$9y+2=6y+3$$, we can substitute $$ rac{1}{3}$$ in for $$y$$ in the equation and see if the resulting equation is true.
Substituting $$ rac{1}{3}$$ in for $$y$$ in the equation $$9y+2=6y+3$$, we get:
$$9\left( rac{1}{3}ight)+2=6\left( rac{1}{3}ight)+3$$
Simplifying this equation, we get:
$$3+2=2+3$$
This equation is true, so $$y= rac{1}{3}$$ is a solution to the equation $$9y+2=6y+3$$.
